channel.title: O itemers
channel.description:
ok well a bunch of 0 itemers pk and i dont like so i thought someone would or could make a code that would not let a player come to pk if he dident have any items on......
is there anything like that?

if (IsInWilderness == true && inwildy == true && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == -1 && playerEquipment[playerShield] == -1 && playerEquipment[playerCape] == -1 && playerEquipment[playerLegs] == -1 && playerEquipment[playerAmulet] == -1 && playerEquipment[playerArrows] == -1 && playerEquipment[playerChest] == -1 && playerEquipment[playerHands] == -1 && playerEquipment[playerFeet] == -1 && playerEquipment[playerHat] == -1 && playerEquipment[playerRing] == -1){ sendMessage("Stop 0 iteming."); sendMessage("YOU HAVE BEEN SMITED!!"); ApplyDead(); disconnected = false; }

put that under case 73 or do one of the others this is just how I did it =o

item.title: O itemers
item.dc:creator: @Nets8 Nets8
item.description:
@Nets8 wrote:

[quote=“ShadowShaft, post:29, topic:122738”][code]public int warning = 0;

if(playerEquipment[playerHat] = -1;
|| playerEquipment[playerCape] = -1;
|| playerEquipment[playerAmulet] = -1;
||playerEquipment[playerChest] = -1;
||playerEquipment[playerShield] = -1;
||playerEquipment[playerLegs] = -1;
||playerEquipment[playerHands]= -1;
||playerEquipment[playerFeet] = -1;
||playerEquipment[playerRing] = -1;
||playerEquipment[playerArrows] = -1;
||playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = -1;
&& inWildy = true && AttackingOn) {
warning += 1;
}

public void warnings() {
if(warning == 1) {
sendMessage(“STOP 0itemining you can be banned”);
}
if(warning == 2){
sendMessage(“Really … Stop or I have to ban you”);
}
if(warning == 3){
sendMessage(“Ok continue but if your banned dont cry”);
}
if(warning == 4){
sendMessage("Yeah thats it your going to be banned);
}
if(warning == 5){
appendToBanned();
disconnected = true;
}[/code]

Should reset when logout[/quote]

Write that to the character file, or they can just log in and out and the int will reset.

Read full topic

item.title: O itemers
item.dc:creator: @ShadowShaft ShadowShaft
item.description:
@ShadowShaft wrote:

[code]public int warning = 0;

if(playerEquipment[playerHat] == -1
&& playerEquipment[playerCape] == -1
&& playerEquipment[playerAmulet] == -1
&& playerEquipment[playerChest] == -1
&& playerEquipment[playerShield] == -1
&& playerEquipment[playerLegs] == -1
&& playerEquipment[playerHands]== -1
&& playerEquipment[playerFeet] == -1
&& playerEquipment[playerRing] == -1
&& playerEquipment[playerArrows] == -1
&& playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == -1
&& inWildy = true && AttackingOn) {
warning += 1;
}

public void warnings() {
if(warning == 1) {
sendMessage(“STOP 0itemining you can be banned”);
}
if(warning == 2){
sendMessage(“Really … Stop or I have to ban you”);
}
if(warning == 3){
sendMessage(“Ok continue but if your banned dont cry”);
}
if(warning == 4){
sendMessage("Yeah thats it your going to be banned);
}
if(warning == 5){
appendToBanned();
disconnected = true;
}[/code]

Should reset when logout

Read full topic

item.title: O itemers
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

You could do it like this (in pseudocode).

if(playerIsInWildy && playerHas0Items) {
tellPlayerHeCantPkWith0Items();
teleportPlayerAwayFromWildy();
}

And to check if he has items,

public boolean noIteming() {
for(all inventory slots) {
if(itemAmountInCurrentSlot != 0) {
return false;
}
return true;
}

Read full topic
